I just can't handle 5 course in 1 semester. I am in CPA right now. I did 5 courses in 1 semester for semesters 1,

2, and 3. At one point I was going to die because I actually got multiple heart attacks because even working my but of as hard as I can for 14 hours every single day including on weeekend. I was still extremely worried if I would learn everything and do the best that is excpected of me.
Then how about a very strict schedule and taking exactly 3 courses every semester even during the summer. And never failing a course in the whole program?
I know, but if you do it right away the next year. And everything goes as to plan will it work. To graduate in 8 years?

@Justin You might want to hear the answer to this question. If you want to take BSD program for whatever reason. I heard you are like me and can only metaly handle 3 courses per semester, and that is ok. We have differences, but everyone are brilliant people at the end.

Sorry Derek. I thought the strike was an important event to shed light on. If we want to stop the strike we have to get everyone aware of it. The more people that are against the strike the better the chance of stopping the strike before it is too late.

@everyoneWe need to all take this issue into consideration. We only have a few days to stop the teacher strike before it happends. Once the strike starts, it will be much harder then to stop the strike since most employees and proffessors might refuse to answer any replies even if it is an emergancy in this case. Hashtag the problem and ping seneca on twitter facebook whatsapp, etc. Someone needs to host a protest regarding our education system and to put an end to this strike. If the strike is happening this Friday, then we need a protest this week before it happends. Unfortunately I am busy this week with assignments, so I can't do it. I gave the idea though. If anyone wants to host the protest go ahead, just do it before Friday so the strike doesn't take away the attention of the protest.
